title.rendered: 6 Amazing Facts You Should Know About Tooth Implant Process

content.rendered:
The tooth implant offers a permanent solution when you are going to have your tooth replaced. The procedure may look a bit scary and painful to those who have not yet undergone this treatment. But you don’t have to worry at all, tooth implants are completely safe and secure. It’s not the process that scares the people, but incomplete facts and knowledge does. If you don’t have complete knowledge about this treatment, then it’s obvious that it will scare you a bit or you might get worried.

So, to keep all your worries away, we are here with this article. We will be discussing some amazing and interesting facts about the dental implant process.

  1. Similarity Between Spaceship & Tooth Implant

The material which is used in the tooth implant is the same used on spaceship engines i.e. Titanium. So, your implants are strong as rockets that go to space. This is the reason why tooth implants are a bit expensive because of the material used.

  1. You’re Not Old Enough to Get Tooth Implant

There is no age restriction for the tooth implant procedure. It’s just that your jaw needs to be fully developed i.e. you should be 17 years or more to get your tooth replaced. 

  1. Tooth Implant Started Way Back in 2000 BC

Most people consider tooth implant as a new process but the truth is, this process started way back in 2000 BC in ancient China. At that time, bamboo pegs were used to replace the missing tooth.

  1. First Titanium Tooth Implant Procedure

The very first titanium tooth implant procedure was successfully completed in 1965 by an orthopedic surgeon named Branemark. This was the first dental implant treatment done on a human volunteer and it was so successful & strong that it lasted for around 40 years until the patient died in 2006.

  1. Less Painful Than Pulling a Tooth

When your tooth is pulled and removed, you may feel a bit of pain if not given anesthesia. But the process of tooth implant seems to be an easy task. The dental implant is much more precise and tends to be less painful. Pain medication and sedation will be given to you during the treatment, so you won’t feel any pain or discomfort.

  1. Massive Success Rate

The dental implant is one of those few treatments that have a higher success rate. These implants are strong and long-lasting, which is why they have a massive success rate. It’s completely safe and secure, but you should get your treatment done with specialized dentists.

If you are going to get your tooth replaced, then you must have proper and complete knowledge about it. Although this treatment got good results and has a high success rate, it’s still good to have knowledge about it. The more you know, the more you feel confident about the treatment.
